attributes.action: give NHS staff an equal pay rise to the armed forces, and not in a staged manner
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
HE Government was on a collision course with nurses and other health workers last night after deciding to award them a staged pay rise below the rate of inflation, while giving the armed forces the highest increase in the public sector.

A 2.5% increase for health staff will be paid in two stages in April and November, effectively worth less than 2% a year, while rises of between 3.3% and 9.2% for servicemen and women will be paid "without delay".

Union leaders described the announcement as a "kick in the teeth" for NHS staff and raised the threat of industrial action.

reasons: False or incomplete name or address information
